intro: Talinum galapagosum, commonly known as the Galápagos hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid climate of the islands. It has palmate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Talinum galapagosum plays an important role in the local ecosystem, providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small animals.
